channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping, 1st March
item.description:
Yet again someone has seen fit to dump all manor of furniture items on the small grassed area as you enter Vincent Close. These arrived Saturday night Sunday morning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of furniture items, 1st March
item.description:
I have reported previously, fly tipping at this location and you have been more than helpful by clearing the site within 24 hrs and have also erected a ‘no fly tipping’ sign. However this morning Sunday 1st March I find an array of items which includes a sofa, sideboard, and other pieces of furniture have been abandoned! I’m not sure what the answer is to resolve this issue other than report it to you on every occasion it occurs. Please note the numerous for sale boards at the flats at the end of Vincent close!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vincent Close, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Loads of fly tipping, 1st March
item.description:
Please install CCTV at this location!!! For as long as I can remember, this spot has been a constant fly tipping hotspot. It is regularly piled high with rubbish, white goods, shopping trolleys and furniture, and it is completely unacceptable. Despite this ongoing issue, a food waste bin has now been installed directly in front of the main bin chute in the same problem area. Why would this be placed in a location that is already struggling with waste management?! The smell is awful, the food waste is attracting huge rats, and the entire area looks and feels disgusting. Residents should not have to live like this. People should not be allowed to repeatedly dump rubbish here without consequences. CCTV would help deter this behaviour and finally hold those responsible accountable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucey Way, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Signs Unreadable, 28th February
item.description:
Three street signs are dirty to the point where you can't read the sign. Two are triangle signs for humps. Both on Hurst Road, in between Crofton Avenue and Shirley Avenue, all signs are in the Hurst Community Centre side of the road, where the trees are low.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 375, Hurst Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Circa 1 sq.m pink vinyl advertisement banner affixed to Council footway railings on the elevated public footway fronting 41, High Street, Beckenham (near Gail's cafe) about 20m S of the jct with Bromley Rd., 28th February
item.description:
Circa 1 sq.m pink vinyl advertisement banner affixed to Council footway railings on the elevated public footway fronting 41, High Street, Beckenham (near Gail's cafe) about 20m S of the jct with Bromley Rd. Conservation Area. The ad is for a women's business event at the Bridge Bar, Beckenham. Seen Friday 27th and Saturday 28/2/26. The Bridge Bar has a track record of flyposting in Beckenham over 20 years. Flyposting is a criminal offence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
